title: General Knowledge Quiz XIII (50 Questions)
description: Challenging but fair across internet tech, literature, earth science, mythology, and economics. No sports content.

items.q: What does DNS stand for on the internet?
items.a: Domain Name System - translates human‑readable names to IP addresses

items.q: Which protocol is used to send email from a client to a server?
items.a: SMTP - Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (submission typically via port 587)

items.q: What technology creates isolated containers at the OS level on Linux?
items.a: Linux containers (namespaces/cgroups) - popularized by Docker

items.q: What does REST stand for in web API design?
items.a: Representational State Transfer - architectural style using stateless operations

items.q: Which version of Internet Protocol offers a 128‑bit address space?
items.a: IPv6 - successor to IPv4 with vastly more addresses

items.q: Which cryptographic protocol secures web traffic with certificates and symmetric keys?
items.a: TLS - Transport Layer Security, successor to SSL

items.q: What is the term for a network of infected machines controlled by an attacker?
items.a: Botnet - can be used for DDoS or spam campaigns

items.q: Which HTTP method is typically used to retrieve a resource without side effects?
items.a: GET - should be idempotent and safe

items.q: What does CDN stand for in content delivery?
items.a: Content Delivery Network - geographically distributed caching system

items.q: Which system maps names to phone numbers for SMS/voice, analogous to DNS for the web?
items.a: ENUM - uses DNS to map E.164 numbers to internet addresses

items.q: Who wrote the play Waiting for Godot?
items.a: Samuel Beckett - seminal absurdist drama first performed in 1953

items.q: Which poet authored The Waste Land (1922)?
items.a: T. S. Eliot - modernist poem with multilingual allusions

items.q: Who wrote the verse epic Paradise Lost?
items.a: John Milton - 17th‑century poem about the Fall of Man

items.q: Which playwright penned A Streetcar Named Desire?
items.a: Tennessee Williams - play set in New Orleans, premiered 1947

items.q: Who authored the poem Ozymandias?
items.a: Percy Bysshe Shelley - sonnet about impermanence of power

items.q: Which Norwegian playwright wrote A Doll’s House?
items.a: Henrik Ibsen - groundbreaking drama on gender and society (1879)

items.q: Which American poet is known for terse, dashed verse and lived in Amherst?
items.a: Emily Dickinson - 19th‑century poet whose work was largely posthumous

items.q: Who wrote the Spanish play Life Is a Dream (La vida es sueño)?
items.a: Pedro Calderón de la Barca - Baroque masterpiece (1635)

items.q: Which poet coined the term ‘confessional poetry’ through works like Ariel?
items.a: Sylvia Plath - mid‑20th‑century American poet

items.q: Who is the author of the play Death of a Salesman?
items.a: Arthur Miller - 1949 Pulitzer‑winning critique of the American Dream

items.q: What scale measures the magnitude of earthquakes logarithmically?
items.a: Moment magnitude scale (Mw) - superseded the older Richter scale for large quakes

items.q: What is the term for a rotating column of air extending from a thunderstorm to the ground?
items.a: Tornado - violently rotating vortex beneath a cumulonimbus cloud

items.q: Which layer of the atmosphere contains the ozone layer?
items.a: Stratosphere - ozone absorbs harmful UV radiation

items.q: What is the boundary between two air masses of different temperatures called?
items.a: Front - warm fronts, cold fronts, and occluded fronts

items.q: Which volcanic rock is full of gas bubbles and can float on water?
items.a: Pumice - vesicular volcanic glass

items.q: What type of rock forms from the alteration of existing rock by heat and pressure?
items.a: Metamorphic rock - e.g., schist, gneiss, marble

items.q: What is the term for the point on Earth’s surface directly above an earthquake’s focus?
items.a: Epicenter - surface projection of the hypocenter

items.q: Which scale rates tropical cyclones in the Atlantic by sustained wind speed?
items.a: Saffir–Simpson scale - categories 1 through 5

items.q: What phenomenon causes coastal water levels to rise due to onshore winds and low pressure?
items.a: Storm surge - major component of hurricane damage

items.q: What is the name for seasonal reversing winds bringing wet and dry seasons in South Asia?
items.a: Monsoon - driven by land‑sea temperature contrasts

items.q: Who is the Greek goddess of wisdom and warfare, born from Zeus’s head?
items.a: Athena - patron of Athens, associated with the owl and olive

items.q: Which Norse hammer‑wielding god is associated with thunder?
items.a: Thor - wielder of Mjölnir, protector of Midgard

items.q: Who is the Egyptian god of the afterlife and judge of the dead?
items.a: Osiris - resurrected ruler of the underworld

items.q: Which Greek hero performed twelve labors as penance?
items.a: Heracles (Hercules) - son of Zeus, famed for strength

items.q: Which Norse trickster god is a shape‑shifter and instigator of chaos?
items.a: Loki - complex figure whose actions precipitate Ragnarök

items.q: Who is the Egyptian sun god often depicted with a falcon head?
items.a: Ra (Re) - solar deity sailing across the sky

items.q: Which Greek underworld is ruled by Hades and inhabited by shades?
items.a: Hades (the Underworld) - includes Elysium and Tartarus

items.q: Which Norse world tree connects the Nine Realms?
items.a: Yggdrasil - immense ash linking the cosmos

items.q: Which Egyptian goddess embodies truth, balance, and cosmic order?
items.a: Ma’at - represented by a feather used in the weighing of the heart

items.q: Which Greek sea god wields a trident and causes earthquakes?
items.a: Poseidon - brother of Zeus and Hades

items.q: What is the term for a persistent rise in the general price level?
items.a: Inflation - erodes purchasing power over time

items.q: Which market structure features many sellers offering identical products?
items.a: Perfect competition - firms are price takers

items.q: What does IPO stand for in finance?
items.a: Initial Public Offering - when a company first sells shares to the public

items.q: Which economist wrote Capital in the Twenty‑First Century (2013) analyzing wealth inequality?
items.a: Thomas Piketty - influential empirical study of capital and income

items.q: What is the formula for compound interest ( annually ) on principal P at rate r for t years?
items.a: A = P(1 + r)^t - growth with reinvested interest

items.q: What is a ‘bear market’ commonly defined as?
items.a: A decline of 20% or more from recent highs - sustained downward trend

items.q: Which ratio measures a firm’s debt relative to shareholders’ equity?
items.a: Debt‑to‑equity ratio - leverage indicator

items.q: What does ROI stand for in evaluating investments?
items.a: Return on Investment - gain relative to cost

items.q: Which institution is the U.S. central bank?
items.a: The Federal Reserve - conducts monetary policy and regulates banks

items.q: What is the unemployment rate measuring?
items.a: Share of the labor force without jobs but actively seeking work
